speakingtree.in/2015/02/the-homonymy-vs-.snippet: 1. Homonymy (Equivocation): where the double meaning resides in one single termnoun or verb. 2. Amphiboly: where the double meaning resides, not in a single word but, in a combination of words proposition, phrase, or sentence.
